intro: Chamaefilix seelosii, commonly known as Seelos' rock-rose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with dense foliage. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
